intro: Oxyanthus speciosus var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
